title: Business Live: FTSE down on record high - BBC News
summary: gkn reveals £ 40m of unexpected legal claims as warns on profit .
wall street stocks boosted by strong retail sales .
chemicals giant bayer sells off unit as tries to secure monsanto deal .
virtual currency bitcoin hits new high in asian trading .
stock exchange consultation on changing listing rules closes today .

documents.title: good night
text: that 's it for another week on business live .
we hope you 've enjoyed our coverage over the past five days .
we 'll be back bright and early at 06:00 on monday morning .
do join us for all the latest breaking news and analysis from the business world .

documents.title: saturday 's ft leads on aramco
text: before we go - a quick look at the front page of tomorrow 's financial times .
saturday 's ft : `` doubts rise on saudi aramco global listing '' ( via @ twitterid # tomorrowspaperstoday # bbcpapers

documents.title: wall street boosted by economic data
text: all three key us stock indexes rose on friday helped by strong retail sales figures and signs that consumer sentiment is riding high .
inflation figures from the labor department also showed consumer prices rose 0.5 % in september , while the year-on-year rate rose to 2.2 % .
the dow jones ended the day at 22,871.72 , that 's 31 points or 0.13 % higher .
the s & p 500 ended up 2 points of 0.09 % at 2,553.17 .
and the tech-heavy nasdaq closed at 6,605.80 , a rise of 14 points or 0.22 % .

netflix shares closed 1.85 % higher - having hit a record high earlier in the day of $ 200.82 - after goldman sachs and others increased their price targets for the stock - ahead of its earnings report on monday .
wells fargo bank ended 2.75 % lower after revenues for the fourth quarter came in below expectations for the fourth quarter in a row due to a decline in mortgage banking revenue .

documents.title: jamie magazine to close
text: jamie oliver is to close his food magazine - the unambiguously-titled jamie magazine - at the end of the year as consumers turn increasingly to online recipes .

a spokeswoman for jamie oliver group said : `` we 've conducted extensive research into our audience needs and while jamie 's books are more popular than ever - 5 ingredients quick & easy food is the fastest-selling jamie book - our audience is increasingly also looking to digital platforms to find content . ''

documents.title: 'shape of your ' goes five times platinum
text: ed sheeran 's shape of you single has gone five times platinum .
when streams and downloads are added together , it works out as three million sales , according to the bpi which represents the uk music industry .
only band aid 's do they know it 's christmas ?
and elton john 's candle in the wind '97 have sold more copies in the uk .
shape of you is also the biggest selling single of 2017 so far , according to official charts data .
the bpi made the announcement on twitter .
read more form newsbeat here
@ edsheeran follows elton john & band aid , as 'shape of you ' is the 3rd single to reach the 3million mark & is now 5x platinum !
# bpiawards
hello @ twitterid , how do u think about @ twitterid international debut album # agnezxmo check this

documents.title: former fifa boss denies allegations
text: the former world football executive jerome valcke has denied allegations that the chief executive of the bein media group nasser al-khelaifi bribed him by letting him use a villa on the italian island of sardinia , reports bbc world service .
mr valcke 's lawyer said he had paid rent for the villa and had a lease .
police have raided and impounded the villa in porto cervo .
swiss prosecutors say mr khelaifi let mr valcke use it in exchange for a discount on middle east television rights for up to the next four world cups .
mr khelaifi , the qatari chairman of paris saint germain , has denied all the allegations .
prosecutors revealed on thursday that in march they 'd opened a second investigation into mr valcke .
he was sacked as secretary-general of world football 's governing body fifa in september 2015 .
author: BBC World Service

documents.title: would you move home on friday 13th ?
text: how sus are you ?
would you move home on friday 13th ?
if not , you 're not alone , it seems .
many people simply do n't like moving house on on that day , figures from the registers of scotland suggest .
analysis of records dating back to 2003 showed that less than half the number of properties expected actually changed hands on that date .
according to data from the previous friday 13th , which occurred in january , 524 residential properties changed hands in scotland .
however , on the equivalent friday in 2016 - which fell on the 15th of the month - 1,321 residential properties were exchanged .
read more here

documents.title: eu says trump has 'no right ' to terminate deal
text: the european union 's foreign policy chief federica mogherini says president trump has no right to terminate the nuclear deal with iran , reports bbc world service .
she said it was not in the hands of any president in the world to terminate an agreement adopted unanimously by the un security council , one that had been implemented and was working .
she said the deal was even more important to preserve at a time of acute nuclear threat .

she added that the international nuclear agency the iaea had certified eight times through strict procedures that iran was keeping its side of the bargain , to make sure its nuclear programme was exclusively for civilian use .
author: BBC World Service

documents.title: trump blow for iran nuclear deal
text: us president donald trump has condemned iran as a `` fanatical regime '' and refused to continue certifying an international nuclear deal .
he said iran had carried out multiple violations of the 2015 deal and said he would work with congress and us allies to repair its many flaws .
but he said that if this did n't happen he would use his powers to terminate us participation in the deal .
mr trump promised to ensure iran never acquired a nuclear weapon and described nuclear agreement with tehran as one of the worst the us had ever signed .
the 2015 nuclear deal struck between iran and five world powers - the us , uk , russia , france , china , and germany - was the signature foreign policy achievement of barack obama 's presidency .

the initial framework lifted crippling economic sanctions on iran in return for limitations to the country 's controversial nuclear energy programme , which international powers feared iran would use to create a nuclear weapon .

documents.title: asterix cover sells for £ 1.2m
text: another auction success story now - and an original illustration for the cover of an early asterix comic book has sold in paris for a record 1.4m euros ( £ 1.2m ) .
the drawing for `` asterix and the banquet '' - called `` le tour de gaul '' in french- was signed by series creators , albert uderzo and rene goscinny .
it had been expected to sell for about 180,000-200,000 euros , according to auction house drouot .
# wolrdrecord pour # uderzo et pour une couverture de bande dessinee ; # asterix fait s'envoler les # enchères : 1 449 000 € # auctionupdate

documents.title: burning money ?
text: a cigar once smoked by former british prime minister winston churchill has sold for $ 12,000 ( £ 9,000 ) , according to the boston-based rr auction house .
churchill partially smoked the 10cm cigar at the le bourget airport in paris on 11 may 1947 .
it was sold on wednesday night to a collector in palm beach , florida .
the buyer 's name was not released .
the half-smoked cigar was kept by a british airman who flew churchill and his wife to and from paris .
read more here

documents.title: iag eyes monarch 's gatwick slots
text: british airways owner iag is interested in the london gatwick slots of failed airline monarch iag boss willie walsh said on friday .
monarch went bust on october 2 , amid strong competition in the sector .

`` with monarch , i think everybody 's interested in slots at gatwick , and that would be principally our interest as well if we can get more slots at gatwick , we 'll certainly be looking for more , '' mr walsh told reuters .
he also said the reduction in capacity was good for the industry .
norwegian air shuttle 's boss said on thursday that he was also interested in the slots , depending on the price and clarification over how the slots will be allocated .

documents.title: roof protest ends
text: a sacked security guard 's 21-hour protest in the roof space of a tesco store has ended after he received a letter to review his dismissal ( see earlier post ) .
adama jammeh climbed onto the girders above the checkouts in tesco extra , reading , on thursday evening .
in a series of facebook videos , the 46-year-old said he was sacked after being wrongly accused of stealing .
in its letter , tesco said evidence suggested mr jammeh may have suffered `` a significant injustice '' .
the former guard was led out of the store by police shortly before 15:00 bst .
he was arrested on sus of public order offences , a thames valley police spokesman said .
read the full story here

documents.title: crack down on fake sickness claims
text: efforts to crack down on uk tourists making fake claims for holiday sickness are being stepped up by the government .
it is proposing rules that would limit payouts by travel companies , which it hopes will deter bogus claims .
the association of british travel agents ( abta ) said there were about 35,000 claims over holiday sickness in 2016 , a 500 % rise since 2013 .
the travel industry says the total cost of all claims was £ 240m in 2016 and risks raising holiday prices for all .
read the full story here

documents.title: sterling 's rise continues
text: let 's check in on the pound now - and it 's been a bit of an up and down day .

sterling rose late on thursday following a report in germany 's handelsblatt suggesting the eu could offer the uk a two-year transitional brexit deal , and it 's managed to cling on to those gains and edge further ahead .
a short while ago it was up 0.33 % against the dollar at $ 1.3307 and 0.23 % higher against the euro at €1.1234 .

documents.title: vedanta will appeal against court ruling
text: more now on the story that the uk court of appeal has ruled that a group of zambian villagers can pursue a claim for damages against the mining giant vedanta resources in the english courts ( see earlier post ) .
they claim their water supplies were contaminated and their health damaged by pollution from a copper mine .
the 1,800 villagers live near the nchanga mine in zambia 's copperbelt .
the mine is operated by vedanta 's subsidiary kcm .

the villagers say their land and livelihood have been destroyed by pollution over a decade , and in 2015 they took their claims to the uk 's high court - because vedanta is listed on the london stock exchange .
vedanta and kcm challenged the jurisdiction of the english courts to hear the case , arguing they should be heard in zambia instead .
today , the court of appeal has ruled in the villagers ' favour .
the decision is being seen by some experts as a warning to other multinational companies with operations overseas .
vedanta and kcm say they 're examining the judgement and will appeal .
author: Vivienne Nunis
Business reporter, BBC News

documents.title: regulator calls for checks on a380 engines
text: the us civil aviation regulator , the faa , has told operators of airbus a380 superjumbos to carry out urgent checks on their engines .
it follows an incident late last month involving an air france a380 that had to make an emergency landing after suffering a major uncontained engine failure while flying from paris to los angeles .
the faa directive applies to aircraft fitted with american-built engine alliance turbofans -about 60 % of the a380s in service .
superjumbos using engines built by rolls royce are not affected .
author: BBC World Service

documents.title: ftse 100 retreats from record high
text: the ftse 100 has retreated from its record high close , ending friday 21 points or 0.28 % lower at 7,535.44 .
mining companies were among the highest climbers , with rio tinto gaining 3.27 % and glencore 2.69 % .

meanwhile , gkn fell by 9.84 % after the engineering company warned its annual profit would fall short of expectations , blaming disappointing aerospace trading and two unexpected legal claims which are likely to result in a charge of about £ 40m in the fourth quarter of this year .
the mid-cap ftse 250 finished 8 points or 0.04 % ahead at 20,259.51 .
on the 250 talktalk was the biggest faller , losing 6.15 % .
the second biggest gain was seen by doorstep lender provident financial which climbed by 12.55 % .
earlier the troubled lender said it had put a recovery plan in place for its home credit business .
in august , shares in the company had dropped by two-thirds in one day after it issued a profit warning .
provident ran into trouble after an attempt to reorganise its door-to-door lending business failed to work .

documents.title: hammond : 'enemy ' is 'out there '
text: chancellor philip hammond has been giving a series of interviews in washington today - and one , in particular , has been seized on by multiple media outlets because of his use of the word `` enemy '' to describe the eu .

speaking to sky new mr hammond said : `` my message is this : i understand that passions are high and i understand that people have very strong views about this but we 're all going to the same place , we all have the same agenda .
`` the enemy , the opponents are out there , they 're on the other side of the negotiating table .
`` those are the people we have to negotiate with , negotiate hard to get the very best deal for britain . ''
chancellor philip hammond has referred to brussels as `` the enemy '' in brexit negotiations
shadow chancellor john mcdonnell says `` insulting the eu is not the way to protect our economic interests ''
philip hammond says he regrets using `` a poor choice of words '' after he referred to the eu as `` the enemy ''
downing st sources have reiterated pm 's support of chancellor philip hammond following his comment on the european union being the `` enemy ''

documents.title: rush to get rid of old £ 1 coins
text: there 's been a big rush to get rid of round pound coins ahead of sunday 's deadline , according to natwest bank .
the old £ 1 will no longer be legal tender from midnight on 15 october .
in the first week of october there was an 80 % increase in the number of £ 1 coins being deposited at natwest branches , says the bank .
it 's reckoned there are still around 450 million round pound coins in circulation with over £ 1.2bn having already been returned to the royal mint .

documents.title: hammond : cabinet united
text: more from kamal ahmed 's interview with chancellor philip hammond now
and mr hammond rejected suggestions that the government seemed to be too engaged in arguing with itself rather than negotiating with the european union .
he said the cabinet was united behind prime minister theresa may 's recent speech in florence setting out her brexit plans and the uk 's future relationship with the european union .
`` everybody in the cabinet is signed up to that position , so we know what our proposal is , we 've put it on the table effectively .
`` now we want the european union to engage with it .

`` i 've said to them in the article i wrote earlier this week , come on kick the tyres , challenge us , ask the questions , we 're ready to have this discussion with you , but let 's behave like grown-ups , let 's talk about the vision for the future , let 's discuss it together and let 's get this thing moving . ''

documents.title: hammond : what business wants from brexit talks
text: in washington , kamal ahmed asked chancellor philip hammond how he thought the brexit negotiations were going and what the brexit process effect was on the uk 's economy .
`` well , as said before , we always knew that the process of negotiations was going to create some uncertainty and that undoubtedly true , '' said mr hammond .
`` if you talk to businesses , they would like us to get it done quickly so that they know clearly what our future relationship with the european union is going to look like . ''

documents.title: hammond : 'i 'm talking britain up '
text: chancellor philip hammond has been accused of being too pessimistic about brexit , and this week told mps on the treasury committee that a `` cloud of uncertainty '' over the outcome of negotiations was `` acting as a dampener '' on the economy .
on friday mr hammond told kamal ahmed that he was optimistic about the uk 's economic future and was in washington to promote it .

what i 'm doing here in washington is talking britain up , talking about britain 's future as a champion of free trade in the global economy , seeking further moves on liberalisation on trade in services which will hugely benefit our economy .

documents.title: hammond : lawson is 'wrong '
text: more from bbc economics editor kamal ahmed 's interview in washington with chancellor philip hammond , now ( see earlier posts ) .
talking about mr hammond 's role in the brexit negotiations former chancellor lord lawson said `` what he [ mr hammond ] is doing is very close to sabotage '' .
responding to lord lawson 's comments , mr hammond said : lord lawson is entitled to his view on this and many other subjects and is n't afraid to express it , but i think he 's wrong . ''

documents.title: 'punish firms that sell inferior version of products '
text: the czech prime minister bohuslav sobotka ( has asked the european union to do more to punish firms that sell inferior versions of their products , especially food , in central and eastern europe .
he told the summit on equal quality of products for all in the slovak capital bratislava that the eu should tighten up its directive on unfair competition .

the slovak prime minister robert fico said it was absolutely unacceptable for food producers to claim that what 's known as dual quality was down to poorer water in the east or specific local tastes .
author: BBC World Service

documents.title: zambian villagers can pursue damages claim
text: nearly 2,000 zambian villagers have been given the go-ahead to pursue a claim for damages in english courts for environmental pollution after london 's court of appeal on friday rejected an appeal by mining group vedanta .

vedanta resources and its zambian subsidiary konkola copper mines had appealed against a ruling in may 2016 when a high court judge decided the claim could proceed on behalf of 1,826 zambian villagers .
the companies wanted the claims to be brought in zambia .

documents.title: us shares rise on strong retail sales
text: all three key us share indexes opened higher on friday after new figures showed the rise in september 's retail sales was the biggest for two and a half years .
the dow jones is at 22,876.96 , up 36 points or 0.16 % .
the s & p 500 is at 2,553.38 , a rise of 2 points or 0.10 % .
and the tech-heavy nasdaq is at 6,606.64 , 15 points or 0.23 % ahead .

all of wall street 's main indexes ended the day lower on thursday amid investor concerns about credit card lending losses in the third quarter at jpmorgan and citigroup and what said about underlying consumer demand .

documents.title: hammond : 'absurd to pretend brexit has n't created uncertainty '
text: the chancellor has described as `` bizarre '' and `` absurd '' accusations that he is talking down the economy by saying that the brexit process has created uncertainty .
in an interview at the international monetary fund meeting in washington , mr hammond said he was a realist and that he wanted to `` protect and prepare '' the economy for the challenges ahead .
`` it is absurd to pretend that the process we are engaged in has n't created some uncertainty , '' he said .
`` but the underlying economy remains robust .
`` i am committed to delivering a brexit deal that works for britain . ''
he refused to answer how he would vote if another referendum was held now .
`` we 've had the referendum , '' he said .
`` you know how i voted in it . ''
author: Kamal Ahmed
Economics editor

documents.title: hammond : accusations are 'bizarre'bbc economics editor tweets
text: earlier today former conservative chancellor lord lawson , told the bbc that philip hammond , the current chancellor , should be removed from office over the brexit negotiations - just the latest criticism he has received over the issue .
mr hammond is seen as one of the most pro-eu cabinet members and pro-brexiteers have accused him of trying to water down or even stop brexit .
earlier this week mr hammond said he was not yet prepared to start spending money on contingency arrangements in the case of britain and the eu being unable to reach a brexit deal .
`` i fear that he is unhelpful - he may not intend it but in practice what he is doing is very close to sabotage , '' mr lawson said .
mr hammond is in washington and has been reacting .
breaking : chancellor describes accusations that he is talking down the economy over brexit as `` bizarre '' and `` absurd '' .

documents.title: fake sickness claims rocketing
text: fake illness claims are now costing european holiday operators up to £ 240m a year , which has the knock-on effect of driving up prices for holidays .

there has been a 500 % increase in false holiday gastric illness claims since 2013 , allegedly due to unscrupulous lawyers cold-calling holidaymakers and persuading them to make fake claims , in order to profit from damages .
the uk government is now asking the travel industry to submit evidence , to help it draw up a plan for cracking down on false claims .

`` these claims are tarnishing british holidaymakers ' reputation abroad , particularly in spain where they are costing hoteliers millions of pounds , '' said the association of british travel agents , which has been campaigning for government assistance for some time .
`` it is crucial that the government brings in new rules which control legal costs on holiday sickness claims as soon as possible . ''

documents.title: question mark over spain 's growth ?
text: the spanish economy is likely to be affected by the political turmoil surrounding catalonia 's intention to become independent .
the government expects spain 's economy to grow 2.6 % in 2018 .
deputy prime minister soraya sainz de santamaria said : .
`` the events that we are experiencing in catalonia make us more prudent .
`` in fact , if there were no quick solution to this issue we should be forced to lower expectations of economic growth for the year 2018 , '' she said .
the deputy prime minister also said that hotel reservations in catalonia were currently falling by 20-30 % .

documents.title: 'do n't let other people take advantage of you '
text: musical legend dolly parton is doling out business advice in an interview with business matters today .
in particular , she recommends you take ownership of all products and services you offer , and that you have back-up plans to fall back on .
here is some useful business advice from musical legend @ twitterid @ twitterid # businessmatters
must have huge tits so people will listen to your music .
do n't make a tit of yourself and be the breast you can .

documents.title: wells fargo hit by mortgage fine
text: wells fargo is the only one of the wall street banks which have reported so far to have had a disappointing third quarter .
it said profit fell by over a fifth to $ 4.6bn compared to $ 5.6bn last year .
revenues dropped 2 % to $ 21.9bn .
the bank said the drop was due to the impact of last year 's $ 1bn settlement of a us department of justice lawsuit over risky mortgages .
the bank 's report said nothing about the fake accounts scandal .
the bank uncovered the issue in august , and said that many as 3.5 million accounts may have been created for customers without permission over about eight years .

documents.title: the shop that comes to you
text: the latest in the bbc 's disruptors ' series features a shop that travels to you .
can you imagine doing the weekly shop in a store with no assistants and no way of paying with cash ?
# thedisruptors
who 's going to stop shoplifters ?
problem is it further commodifies transactions .
payment processing firms making a killing off technology in the name of progress .
sadly , yes
horrible
no i like to deal with real human beings
i 'd tell them to go fuck themselves .

documents.title: on the roof
text: a tesco security guard who claims he was `` sacked for no reason '' is still protesting from the roof of the tesco extra supermarket in reading .
the man has been live-streaming his protest for over 14 hours on facebook , after climbing onto the girders above the checkouts at 18:15 bst on thursday .
shoppers were asked to abandon their trolleys and leave the store when the incident began .
the man is understood to be in a long-running dispute with the supermarket and security firm , tss .
tesco says he is not directly employed by the supermarket .
he is believed to have been protesting outside the supermarket for several months with banners .

documents.title: china 's great wall admits bmw talks
text: china 's great wall motor has finally formally admitted it is in talks with bmw to cooperate on vehicles including those the german firm produces under the mini brand .
reports surfaced earlier this week that the duo were considering some kind of joint venture .
great wall suspended trading in its shares on thursday , but says they 'll resume trading on monday .

documents.title: arriva north west bus drivers to strike
text: more than 2,000 bus drivers and engineering staff working for arriva north west are set to stage a series of one-day strikes in a dispute over pay .

members of unite will walk out on october 19 , 23 and 30 , affecting bus services operating out of arriva bus depots in birkenhead , bolton , bootle , macclesfield , runcorn , st helens , speke , southport , winsford and wythenshaw .
unite said talks over pay had broken down

documents.title: bank of america beats trading slowdown
text: bank of america corp has managed to increase third quarter profit by 13 % to $ 5.59bn despite trading headwinds .
revenues rose just 1 % to $ 21.8bn from $ 21.6bn , dragged down by a 15 % plunge in sales and trading revenue .
the bank blamed tough comparisons for the same quarter last year for the drop in trading revenues .

documents.title: stagecoach shares dip
text: jp morgan 's decision this morning to cut its price target for transport group stagecoach to 131p from 149p has had little impact .
the group 's shares are currently down just 0.3 % .
jp morgan cited concerns over rising wages for bus and coach drivers for the price target cut .
staffing costs currently stand at 50-60 % of revenue .
just 1 % of wage inflation in the company 's regional bus business has hit overall group operating profit by around 4 % .

documents.title: life saving apps ?
text: india 's farmers have never had it easy ; drought , crop failure , low market prices and lack of modernisation have taken their toll on the nation 's population , about half of whom work in agriculture .
every year thousands of farmers take their own lives .
so can crop management apps help ?
these apps can recognise which pests and diseases are damaging crops .
could they also save lives ?
does it detect donald trump ?
i would like to know what network hes on for it to work in the middle of what appears to be one large mother trucking field !

documents.title: eu space egg evacuated
text: the so called `` space egg '' building - the european counci 's new brussels headquarters - has been evacuated .
the building is where next week 's meeting of eu leaders will take place .

`` a technical issue affecting the ventilation in the kitchens of the europa building , producing noxious fumes in the kitchens , has led to a number of kitchen staff falling ill , '' the european council said in statement .
it said next week 's summit would go ahead as planned .

documents.title: kobe steel shares slump again
text: stocks in japan 's third largest steelmaker - kobe steel - have fallen sharply once again after the firm widened the data scandal to include 500 companies , more than double the number originally thought .
`` combined with previously announced clients , it will total about 500 firms , '' senior kobe steel executive yoshihiko katsukawa , told a presss conference in tokyo .
the losses at kobe steel were in contrast to asia 's main stock markets which managed to eek out small gains at the end of the trading week .
tokyo 's nikkei 225 clocked a gain of 0.1 % , up 200.46 points , ending the day at 21,155.18 .
hong kong 's hang seng closed marginally higher , up 17.4 points at 28,476.43 .
author: Ashleigh Nghiem
Business reporter in Singapore

documents.title: uber files appeal in london
text: uber has filed an appeal against transport for london 's decision not to renew its london licence at westminster magistrates ' court .

`` while we have today filed our appeal so that londoners can continue using our app , we hope to continue having constructive discussions with transport for london , '' a spokesperson for uber said .
`` as our new ceo has said , we are determined to make things right . ''

documents.title: asos rolls out same-day delivery
text: online fashion retailer asos has teamed up with the on the dot delivery service to offer same-day deliveries for london customers .
customers in london can now choose asos instant delivery when they checkout and pay £ 12.95 for the service .
asos plans to start same-day delivery in other uk cities over the coming months .

documents.title: pound ticks higher
text: the pound is having a pretty good day so far .
it 's currently up 0.4 % against the dollar and euro at $ 1.33110 and €1.12540 respectively .
analysts are linking the rise to a report in germany 's handelsblatt suggesting the eu could offer the uk a two-year transitional brexit deal .
but just yesterday it fell on the apparent deadlock in the eu and uk brexit talks .
commerzbank says investors need to be wary .
`` current levels are based on the hope that everything will be ok in the end .
however , until this reliably emerges there is a considerable risk of the gbp collapsing , '' it warns .

documents.title: amazon to create 1,200 new jobs
text: amazon has announced that it will be opening a new fulfilment centre in bolton , in the north west of england in 2018 .
the new centre will see the creation of 1,200 new permanent jobs , and the centre will also feature advanced robotics technology developed by the internet retail giant .

last year amazon had to defend its employment practices after a bbc reporter , working undercover at an agency which was contracted by amazon to deliver parcels , spoke to drivers who claimed they worked illegally long hours and were expected to deliver up to 200 parcels a day .
at the time , amazon said it was committed to ensuring drivers drive safely and legally , and are `` fairly compensated '' .

documents.title: mps put pressure on city watchdog
text: an influential committee of mps is putting more pressure on the uk 's financial watchdog to publish a report into misconduct at rbs .
the treasury committee said it could use `` formal powers '' to demand publication of a financial conduct authority report leaked to the bbc .
business journalist joe lynam says it 's the second time the treasury select committee has called for the full report into the activities of grg to be published by the fca .
`` the fca says that it was never its intention to publish the damning report , which the bbc has seen in full .

`` but this creative solution by the treasury committee to allow one of its special legal advisers to assess the 300 plus page report and report back , may satisfy both sides ( the fca and the tsc ) in this standoff - and grg 's victims as well , '' he says .

documents.title: listen to the computer
text: humans might have been all aflutter about brexit 's effects on the uk economy and how us sanctions against iran will affect oil prices , but artificial intelligence seems to be taking a more measured view .

`` we 've been moving towards trading algorithms for a while now and even yesterday , i would have expected the euro to be the stronger [ currency ] in the euro sterling pairing , but in actual fact it was the sterling that came off better , '' praefinium partners ' chief executive alpesh patel told bbc business live .
`` we had a room full of people talking about it , and our trading algorithm was the only one that got it right .

`` rationally you think oil should spike up because of the sanctions on iran , there should be less supply instead we 're not seeing that , we 're seeing [ that ] actually they might be reducing volatility and making smoother trends . ''
author: BBC Business Live

documents.title: squaring the circle ?
text: former uk negotiator to the eu steve bullock says `` the circle ca n't be squared '' on irish border issue in # brexit negotiations # wakeuptomoney
all goods will either have to fly in or come by boat , the mainland will become the border and eventually we can give the # dup back # bonus
irish border solution is continued membership of the customs union .
puncto finale .
if uk gov't ca n't define brexit , nothing progresses

documents.title: blu tack - who came up with that ?
text: the fact it leaves marks all over your wall may annoy you , but it 's made a fortune for the person who came up with it .
see the latest `` million dollar idea '' from the bbc 's aaron heslehurst to find out more .
how did blu tack become a # milliondollaridea ?
it all started at a glue factory in leicester @ twitterid finds out for # talkingbusiness
happy friday the 13 aaron !
ha - is there such a thing wanda ?
have a great weekend and `` see '' you next week
bob called .
bob 's your uncle .
aaron is awesome .
looking for brand identity design contact :

documents.title: 'questions remain ' on aramco
text: responding to financial regulator boss andrew bailey 's letter on the proposed stock exchange listing rules , treasury chair nicky morgan says `` questions remain about the level of political involvement in the consultation . ''
in his letter , mr bailey disclosed that the financial conduct authority met with aramco before coming out with its proposals in july .
`` we emphasised during those conversations that we were reviewing the listing regime , '' he wrote .
ms morgan says she plans to quiz mr bailey further over the issue at a hearing later this month .
the uk 's world-class reputation for upholding strong corporate governance must n't be watered down , '' she says .

documents.title: provident financial shares soar
text: despite etx capital 's verdict that provident financial 's recovery plans are `` flawed '' investors clearly have a different opinion .
the shares are currently up an impressive 15 % at 119.5p - almost double their price in august when the firm issued a second profit warning and said its chief executive was leaving .

documents.title: provident financial recovery plan 'flawed '
text: troubled british lender provident financial says it has put in place a recovery plan for its home credit business , after ending its 137-year-old model of door-to-door lending using self-employed agents in august .
the new plan means 300 collection managers who used to work part-time will now be employed in order to help `` re-establish relationships with customers '' .
agents told the bbc in september that many older customers were sad because they had enjoyed the interaction when the managers showed up on their doorsteps .

`` getting the customer service and management structure right , as well as sorting the tech glitches , will help provident to recover some lost ground , but it 's hard to see it ever getting back to where it was , '' said etx capital 's senior market analyst neil wilson .
`` the employment of 300 part-time collection managers - largely from the old agent base - is an admission that the new model is flawed . ''

documents.title: regulator to 'consider feedback ' on listing rules
text: financial conduct authority boss andrew bailey says he will `` take all feedback into account '' in deciding whether to go ahead with its proposed change in stock market listing rules .

most believe the rule shift is a way to persuade saudi aramco to choose london for its stock market listing , with the oil giant reported to be valued at a whopping $ 2 ( £ 1.5tn ) - a huge price tag that would also generate hundreds of millions of dollars in fees for investment bankers , lawyers and other professional firms involved in stock market flotations .
but mr bailey has written to treasury chair nicky morgan saying `` the proposal is designed for all companies in this situation '' not just aramco .
saudi aramco plans to list just 5 % of its shares .
but uk rules state more than 25 % of shares should be listed to stop a single shareholder having too much dominance .

documents.title: presenter scores 0
text: round 1 of # wallpaper challenge - @ twitterid 0 ; stuart from @ twitterid 1 .
round 2 coming up on @ twitterid next
looking good guys ! !

documents.title: ftse has that friday feeling
text: so far this morning the ftse 100 is down 0.4 % at 7,524.43 , flagging after yesterday 's record close .
gkn is the biggest loser , down almost 8 % after its surprise profit warning this morning .

documents.title: the battle of the painters
text: presenter ben thompson versus the professional painter at 8.50am .
tune in to find out who will win .
i 've got the kit , just need the skills .
i 've agreed to take on the wallpaper hanging expert at 0850 on @ twitterid
go on , i know you are dying to ask - what difference will this make to the value of my house ? ''
i think the wallpaper trend more to do with staying put & choosing decor you like , not trying to appeal to buyers
i 'm sure you 're right but how long before someone asks what does wallpaper do to the salability/value of my home ?
ben would be wonderful for you to spend a bit of time at the dulux accadamy for even more tips on wallpaper hanging @ twitterid @ twitterid
if i can do it , you can !
i hung this all by myself !
at least ben does n't need a ladder !
you 're always doing work on your house bet you ace it
i 'm looking forward to this !
what could possibly go wrong ?
he had better look out then ur good at it ben
after watching , i would stick to the day job !
@ twitterid look your sleeve is on the box .
now ben will you be using this skill on your new home .
diy ben !
who has perfectly flat walls !
try pattern match when the wall bows out
yes spiders are really useful but i still do n't like them especially the big ones !
what could possible go wrong ?
hey , we 're going to watch wallpaper dry !
slow news day ?
you surely have a reach advantage right from kick-off ?

documents.title: the enemy of my enemy is my enemy ?
text: toshiba has said it wants to make a joint investment in memory chips with sandisk given competition with samsung .
however , sandisk is owned by western digital , which is currently embroiled in a bitter legal battle with toshiba over the japanese firm 's memory chip business .

the japanese giant wants to flog its flagship semiconductor assets to a consortium led by bain capital try to raise some cash after billions of dollars of losses incurred in toshiba 's us nuclear unit .
but western digital has tried to block this sale , and has been feuding bitterly with its japanese partner , having submitted its own bid for the prized chip business .
toshiba hopes to team up with sandisk for a new memory chip line at its yokkaichi plant , but will western digital want to make a pact and circle the wagons with toshiba against samsung ?

documents.title: best spend your old pound coins quick
text: just a reminder , from monday the old pound coin will no longer be legal tender .
some businesses will still continue to accept the old £ 1 coins for a while , but they are under no obligation to do so and can refuse the currency .

if you would like to get rid of your old pound coins , or you discover any hidden around your home , you can either take them over to a bank , or you can help children in need by taking your round pounds to drop-off points .
the drop-off points are located at most banks and building societies , as well as the post office , boots , greggs , cineworld or welcome break .
pudsey is hoping to collect as many old pound coins as possible before the big appeal day on 17 november .

documents.title: ashmore assets up 11 %
text: emerging markets-focused asset manager ashmore group has reported that assets under management rose 11 % in its first quarter ending 30 september , thanks to net inflows of new client money and investment gains .
the firm said assets under management increased by $ 6.3bn ( £ 4.75bn ) during the period , including a positive investment performance of $ 2.3bn and net inflows of $ 4.3bn .
`` investors are increasingly focusing on emerging markets and it is encouraging to see strong inflows this quarter , '' said ashmore group 's chief executive mark coombs .

documents.title: a helping hand for hotels
text: have you got any exotic weekend plans ?
discounted luxury travel deals website secret escapes has raised £ 83m in its most recent funding round and is now present in 20 countries .
the uk firm says this is partly down to support from hotels .

`` the key thing about our hoteliers is they recognise we 're bringing them incremental bookings , and they really value that , '' alex saint , secret escapes ' chief executive told the today programme .

`` their empty hotel rooms are an asset that is just sitting there , and if they can fill those rooms at a reasonable price , then they 're making a really significant profit on rooms that would otherwise go to waste . ''
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: aviva to exit taiwan
text: insurance firm aviva has announced it is selling its entire 49 % stake in its taiwanese joint venture first aviva life to its joint venture partner first financial holding .
aviva says the business `` is not central '' to its strategy , which is to focus on markets where it can achieve scale and profitability , or have a distinct competitive advantage .

`` we have refocused aviva 's asian business on core markets where we have excellent opportunities to grow , '' said chris wei , executive chairman of aviva asia and global chairman of aviva digital .

documents.title: gkn warns on profit
text: engineering firm gkn has reported its latest trading update early due to two unexpected legal claims which it says are likely to result in a charge of around £ 40m in the fourth quarter of this year .
it 's keeping shtum on what exactly these claims are , simply saying they 're `` commercially sensitive with no additional information disclosable at this time '' .
as a result , it has warned that pre-tax profit will `` only be slightly above 2016 '' .
`` it is disappointing that we expect to have to provide for two unexpected claims which will slow our steady growth in profits , '' says gkn boss nigel stein .

documents.title: cure for uk 's productivity problem ?
text: there needs to be a `` massive '' investment in public transport in the west midlands , says the region 's mayor andy street .
mr street argues that investment in transport and communications could help cure the uk 's sluggish growth in productivity .
`` if you improve your mobile broadband speeds , you improve the productivity of your business .
if you reduce congestion you improve productivity , '' he told the today programme .
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: catch up on wake up to money
text: had a sneaky friday lie-in and missed radio 5 's wake up to money ?
do n't worry you can still listen to it via the podcast .
just click below .
do n't say we 're not helpful !
missed friday 's # wakeuptomoney ?
get all today 's business and finance news on the podcast

documents.title: small businesses 'need help '
text: the uk government needs to pay attention to small businesses , cmc market analyst michael hewson says .
`` small businesses have been complaining about business rates .
small businesses make up a big , big chunk of uk gdp , '' he tells the today programme .
`` this is something retailers have been complaining about - if you look at the high street now , you 'll see there are a lot of empty shops , '' he says .
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: 'deplorable ' uk mobile phone coverage
text: mobile phone coverage in the uk is `` frankly deplorable '' , says the chairman of the national infrastructure commission lord adonis .
`` making a mobile phone call is rather like watching an early charlie chaplin black and white film where the is fuzzy and it disappears every ten seconds or so .
`` and try making a mobile phone call on a train and it 's nearly impossible across much of the network , '' lord adonis says .
urban congestion is also a big problem - traffic speeds in our cities have been falling dramatically over the last five years .
in much of london they are lower than they were in 1914 , according to the labour peer .
he 's launching a public consultation in birmingham today alongside five of the uk 's metropolitan mayors .
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: aramco - will it or wo n't it list in london ?
text: the issue of a possible london listing for shares in saudi aramco , the world 's biggest oil firm , continues to be contentious .
the financial conduct authority consultation on changing the listing rules to enable the oil giant , which is only planning to sell 5 % of its shares , to list in london closes today .
normally firms need to list 25 % of their shares to be allowed to list .
but ashley hamilton claxton , corporate governance manager at royal london asset management , said the rules should not be bent .
`` we 've set high standards in london for a very important reason .
these governance rules are there to protect that capital .
[ changing the requirement ] would be a significant change and a weakening of those rules , '' she says .
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: bayer in €5.9bn sell-off
text: german chemicals giant bayer has sold a chunk of its seed and herbicide businesses for a whopping €5.9bn to basf .
bayer , which is still trying to complete last year 's $ 66bn purchase of gm seeds business , is selling off assets to appease the competition authorities .
the takeover would create the world 's biggest seeds and pesticides company .
the deal with basf is conditional upon bayer 's acquisition of monsanto going through , basf and bayer said .

documents.title: provident financial confirms loss
text: troubled doorstep lender provident financial has confirmed its consumer credit division ( ccd ) will lose between £ 80m and £ 120m for the full year .
but the company says it 's already carried out `` a number of actions '' which it says will help deliver the `` necessary improvement in customer service and financial performance '' .
the company also confirms it 's officially on the hunt for a new chief executive after existing boss peter crook left in august .
provident has some 2.5 million customers , many of whom would not qualify for a standard bank loan and are therefore categorised as `` sub-prime '' ,

documents.title: bitcoin rival gets new fan
text: talking of virtual currencies , a new one called electroneum being launched in the uk , has gained a surprising fan - former west ham united , portsmouth , tottenham hotspur and birmingham city manager harry redknapp .
the rare tweet from mr redknapp , who last took to twitter in august and normally restricts his tweeting to football matters , was spotted by the guardian .

documents.title: bitcoin hits another new high
text: another day , another record .
virtual currency bitcoin has hit yet another new high today , hot on the heels of thursday 's all-time high .
it rose as much as 7.4 % to a high of $ 5,846 in asian trading , according to reuters data , before easing to $ 5,700 .
but the price has been notoriously volatile .
the digital currency plunged below $ 3,000 in mid-september after the chinese authorities announced a crackdown .
beijing decided to ban digital currencies as part of a plan for reducing the country 's financial risks .

documents.title: europe needs assurance from the uk
text: industrial manufacturer seetru 's boss also says they need more certainty going forward .
`` the european market needs assurances that there will be no delays to customers .
that needs to be done very quickly , '' seetru 's managing director andrew varga told the today programme .
`` [ there are ] huge risks for us we 're going to have to put a customer hub into europe in order to cope with the worst-case scenario of customer friction . ''
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: export woes
text: despite improvements in the manufacturing sector , the uk economy grew at a muted rate in the third quarter of 2017 , with both domestic sales and orders remaining static , according to the british chambers of commerce ( bcc ) latest survey .
industrial manufacturer seetru says there is an `` accelerating reduction in the order pool from europe '' .
`` clearly uncertainty is having a real effect on customers and which countries they buy from .
they 're not buying from the uk anymore , '' seetru 's managing director andrew varga told the today programme .
`` [ the uk market ] is depressed .
like-for-like sales are clearly down about 10 % , no question this is all down to uncertainty at the moment . ''
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: china trade surges
text: china 's exports and imports surged in september , according to official data .
customs figures , just published , show exports grew 8.1 % and imports expanded 18.7 % last month .
that compares with a 5.5 % rise in exports and a 13.3 % jump in imports seen the month before .

`` today 's figures suggest that not only has strong foreign demand continued to prop up manufacturing activity in china but domestic demand remains resilient too , '' julian evans-pritchard , china economist at capital economics says .
but he points out that the figures were boosted by timing because there were more working days last month compared with last year 's period .

documents.title: uk and eu 'need a mediator '
text: andy rogers , director at the centre for effective dispute resolution ( cedr ) , says having a mediator would speed up progress on the talks between the eu and the uk .
`` one of the things is how painfully slow this is moving .
they [ a mediator ] can confidentially find out the priorities and speed things up , '' he says .
but he admits that finding the right person `` can sometimes be a real headache in itself , '' but he insists it would help both sides to `` through some of the messiness '' .
author: BBC Radio 5 live

documents.title: eu talks 'are n't like buying a car '
text: the eu 's chief negotiator , michel barnier , has said there is a deadlock over the uk 's brexit bill , with insufficient progress to move to the next stage of post-brexit trade talks .
steve bullock , a former uk negotiator with the eu , says it 's `` fair to say '' the government 's negotiating strategy so far has been inept .
`` this is n't buying a car or a house , on the eu side it 's a question of what is actually owed and committed to .
`` the idea that you can say you 'll meet your obligations as theresa may did in florence and then say but i 'll only pay £ 20bn does n't make sense .
that 's why we 're at an impasse , '' he says .
author: BBC Radio 5 live

documents.title: cook-it-yourself takes off
text: it may not seem like an obvious business success story , but the rise of services which deliver packaged recipes and ingredients to your door , which you then cook yourself , has taken off around the world .
hellofresh , a recipe kit delivery start-up , said earlier this week that it 's planning to float on the stock exchange with plans to raise up to €300m in the flotation .
the german firm operates in 10 countries including the us .
grocer magazine news analysis editor emma weinbren says there 's growing demand for this kind of service despite the hefty price tag of around £ 6.50 per individual portion .
`` a lot of it is to do with convenience .
the idea of having everything delivered to your doorstep , you do n't even need to measure out your ingredients , '' she says .
she also says it fits into an `` increasing foodie culture '' with people more interested in preparing their own food but not necessarily knowing where to start .
emma admits she 's a fan of the kits .
her own favourite hellofresh meal ?
she says it was a teriyaki chicken with coconut rice dish .
author: BBC Radio 5 live

documents.title: samsung boss quits over crisis
text: samsung electronics chief executive kwon oh-hyun has resigned citing an `` unprecedented crisis '' .
it is the latest management upheaval at the firm after the heir of the entire samsung group was imprisoned for corruption in august .
mr kwon is one of three co-chief executives of samsung electronics .
his resignation comes on the same day the firm forecast record quarterly profits , citing higher memory chip prices .
read more here

documents.title: good morning
text: happy friday .
the british chambers of commerce has warned the uk is growing at a `` muted '' rate with the all-important services sector `` static '' despite strong manufacturing growth .
overnight ryanair said it would take the €210m lufthansa deal to buy parts of failed german carrier air berlin to european competition authorities .
and soon we 'll find out how doorstep lender provident financial is doing .
the firm 's boss quit in august after announcing the firm 's second profit warning in just two months .
its results are out at 7am .
